result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raven L. Maye

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Attorney  Russ S. Kort appeared by video for Defendant Raven L. Maye. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Raven L. Maye appeared by phone.
Cases heard are 15CM-340 and 20CF-340.

Court calls cases.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

Court has reviewed the motion to reopen extradition. 
There is now a governor's warrant that is authorized and the Court is limited. Statute does not provide a bond.
Court addresses the parties further.

Atty Jambois addresses the Court, proposes for Defendant to take the 10 days to surrender himself to Illinois and have a bond be set. Then the State would not oppose to this.

Court is not giving Defendant 10 days, the warrant is active now.
Defendant addresses the Court. 
Atty Kort addresses the parties, advised his client to turn himself in. 

Atty Kort states there is a plea and sentencing agreement for today.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands the agreement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
20CF-340: No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea.
Court informs defendant of the constitutional rights. 
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Defendant understands that he may appear in person, rather than videoconferencing.
Defendant has been able to hear and understand the Court.
Defendant waives his right to be present in this courtroom in this proceeding and consents to proceeding.
BY THE COURT: Court finds that Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently consents to the use of video conferencing at this proceeding.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
20CF-340: Felon in possession of firearm.
15CM-340: Dismissed and read in.

Atty Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. There is no victim that wish to make a statement.
Atty Kort makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
20CF-340:
Jail sentence for 6 months.
Jail credit for 3 days.
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason that the Sheriff will allow.
Imposed and Stayed.
Probation for a period of 2 years.
Conditions:
Do not possess any firearms.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Pursue full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time.
No contact with M.H.
Pay court costs and surcharges.
Provide DNA Sample.

Court recommends Defendant to turn himself over for further proceedings.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights filed by Atty Russ S Kort
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 12, 2021 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 21, 2020 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 30, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2020 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Family Safety Plan filed by M.M.H.:  I want contact with the defendant and I am fiing this document as requiredby the Court order for contact to be allowed as stated in the bond condition.
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2020 at 11:00 am.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  victim  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Court hearings are exempt from this condition.

01:28 PM Defendant Raven L. Maye in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court questions the Defendant as to the reason for missing Court. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Court questions if the Defendant has received the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Bond is set by the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2020 at 11:00 am.

**Defendant unable to pay the $500 cash alternative/new date provided (but incorrect time)**
     WARRANT CANCELLED BY PCSD
Return on warrant on August 31, 2020 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Raven L. Maye
Current: 2701 Forest Dr., Trailer 86, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 08-19-2020)
Prior: 1305 Ridge Road, Custer, WI 54423 United States
**PCSD CANCELLED WARRANT ON THEIR END**  Cash Alternative not paid/new date & time given for next hearing
Warrant Paperwork Returned from Sheriff's Dept.
